In the oracle bone script , an ideogrammic compound ( 會意 / 会意 ): 午 (“pestle”, the original form of 杵 ) + 廾 (“two hands”) + two 禾 (“grain”). The most conservative variant is 𥢮 . A form of its bronze inscription containing only one 禾 developed into the subsequent small seal script form in Shuowen . The 午 and 廾 components have fused into 𡗗 in the modern form.
According to Shuowen Jiezi , the glyph is an ideogrammic compound ( 會意 / 会意 ): abbreviated 舂 ( “ to pound grain ” ) + 禾 ( “ grain ” ) – husked grain. However this would necessitate a phonological shift that is considered unlikely, and furthermore is likely a folk etymology altogether. [ 1 ]
